Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-CPb (UCLL1c; natural AMPs; the gopher frog, amphibians, animals; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: the New World frogLithobates capito, North America

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis revealed 92.3% similarity toTemporin-1ARa.  Antinacterial activity was not reported due to a limited amount of material. We filled up this gap by using a synthetic peptide.  Active against S. aureus USA300 (MIC 12.5 uM), S. epidermidis 1457 (MIC 12.5 uM), B. subtilis 168 (MIC 25-50 uM), C. albicans (MIC 50 uM) and  C. tropicalis (6.2-12.5 uM) (Mishra Wang et al. 2018). Updated 5/2018.
Literature Information.Author: Conlon JM, Meetani MA, Coquet L, Jouenne T, Leprince J, Vaudry H, Kolodziejek J, Nowotny N, King JD2009
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin secretions of the New World frogs Lithobates capito and Lithobates warszewitschii (Ranidae).
